sentences.en: "He wouldn't have come near us because of his closeness to the Gaddafi regime, because he was an acolyte, " Mr Shamis says.
sentences.cn: 因为同卡扎菲政权的关系，他不会靠近我们，因为他是个助手

sentences.en: Acolyte 500 + 2 bonus to self spell skills ( body, mind, spirit ).
sentences.cn: 侍僧500+2自我魔法技能 ( 灵魂 、 心智 、 肢体 ).

sentences.en: Acolyte: Faster, my brethren! If we lose the shipment, the master will have our hides!
sentences.cn: 侍僧: 快点, 弟兄们! 如果我们弄丢了货物, 主人会要了我们的命!

sentences.en: Acolyte: Seek out the local graveyards. Those buried there will serve you well.
sentences.cn: 寺僧: 找到当地的坟地. 那些埋在地下的尸体将为你服务.

sentences.en: Deng spent the first half of his 76-year career in the party as a Mao acolyte -- and he followed his master in the somewhat cavalier disregard with which he held human life.
sentences.cn: 在邓七十六年的职业生涯中，有一半时间在党内作为毛的助手，并且同那位主人一样，在某些方面他也同样对于人的生命漠不关心。

sentences.en: Grandmother Chen and the " acolyte " had already stolen away.
sentences.cn: 陈二奶奶和 “ 童儿 ” 已经偷偷的溜了.

sentences.en: Only one youth survived–a pilgrim who had come as an acolyte, seeking wisdom, but had yet to be admitted to the monastery.
sentences.cn: 只有一个人幸免于难，他是来星隐寺寻求智慧，却尚未得到寺院认可的侍僧。

sentences.en: Or I, who makes me sad ? The acolyte.
sentences.cn: 还是我 -- 是谁叫我黯然愁苦?

sentences.en: Richard Brome, an acolyte of Ben Jonson's, wrote "The Jovial Crew" in 1641.
sentences.cn: 本·琼森的仆人理查德·布罗姆在1641年写了《一伙快活人》。

trans.tran_cn: 助手，随从，新手，<宗>（天主教）侍祭
trans.tran_en: someone who serves a leader or believes in their ideas
